title: New AI tool describes surroundings to visually impaired people
description: The app Be My Eyes has a new artificial intelligence tool that provides low vision or blind users with an audio description of whatever they are facing. NBC News’ Ellison Barber spoke with one user who is testing the virtual assistant and says it is helping him do more on his own.

title: Tucker Carlson leaves Fox, Don Lemon fired from CNN
description: In a surprise statement, Fox News announced that host Tucker Carlson will be leaving the network. CNN also announced host Don Lemon’s departure from the network. Meanwhile, NBCUniversal CEO Jeff Shell left the company after an investigation revealed “inappropriate conduct,” according to Comcast. NBC News’ Stephanie Gosk reports.

title: Georgia prosecutor to reveal charging decisions in Trump probe this summer
description: Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis said she'll announce charging decisions stemming from her investigation into possible interference in the 2020 election by former President Donald Trump and his allies as early as mid-July.

title: Star NFL quarterback Aaron Rodgers traded from Green Bay Packers to New York Jets
description: The Green Bay Packers traded star quarterback Aaron Rodgers to the New York Jets, ending the sure-fire Hall of Fame player's storied 18-season run on the famed Frozen Tundra.

title: Surviving roommate in Idaho student slayings asks not to appear at suspect's hearing
description: One of two housemates who were inside an off-campus residence when four University of Idaho students were slain in November is asking a judge to reject a request by the defense that she attend an upcoming hearing for murder suspect Bryan Kohberger.

title: Proud Boys were 'thirsting for violence' on Jan. 6, DOJ says in closing arguments
description: Five members of the far-right Proud Boys were "thirsting for violence" on Jan. 6, Justice Department says in seditious conspiracy trial closing arguments.

title: CNBC anchor Hadley Gamble accused NBCUniversal CEO Jeff Shell of sexual harassment, her lawyer says
description: Hadley Gamble, a CNBC anchor and international correspondent, accused former NBCUniversal chief executive Jeff Shell of sexual harassment and sex discrimination in a complaint to the media company, her lawyer stated to NBC News on Monday.

title: Toddler who was found in the jaws of an alligator was drowned by father, authorities say
description: The Florida toddler who was found last month in the jaws of an alligator was drowned by his father, police said Monday.

title: Don Lemon says he has been fired from CNN
description: Don Lemon was terminated from his anchor role at CNN, he announced Monday.

title: Tucker Carlson and Fox News part ways
description: Fox News said it is parting ways with Tucker Carlson, the network's most popular prime-time host and a leading voice in the modern conservative movement.

title: Utility bills could spike as the EPA moves to limit 'forever chemicals' in drinking water
description: A new Environmental Protection Agency proposal aimed at eliminating “forever chemicals” in drinking water could cost local water utilities millions of dollars

title: Supreme Court deals blow to oil companies by turning away climate cases
description: The Supreme Court declined to hear disputes between oil companies and municipalities that could impact efforts to hold businesses accountable for climate change.

title: Bed Bath & Beyond's bankruptcy: What you need to know
description: Bed Bath & Beyond filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy Sunday, with plans to wind down its entire business.

title: Supreme Court takes up legal spat over public officials blocking people on social media
description: The Supreme Court will decide whether public officials violate the Constitution when they block members of the public on social media — an issue Trump faced.

title: Susan Rice to step down as Biden's domestic policy chief
description: President Joe Biden’s domestic policy adviser, Susan Rice, is stepping down from her post next month, multiple current and former senior administration officials told NBC News.

title: Kim Potter, the Minnesota officer who fatally shot Daunte Wright, released from prison
description: Kim Potter, the Minnesota police officer who mistook her gun for a Taser and killed Daunte Wright in 2021, was released from prison early Monday.

title: Meghan dismisses report she’s skipping coronation over letter to King Charles
description: Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex, has dismissed a U.K. media report claiming that she decided to skip King Charles III's upcoming coronation over his response to a letter she sent him about "unconscious bias" in Britain's royal family.

title: McCarthy faces his first big test as speaker: Defusing a debt ceiling time bomb
description: Kevin McCarthy faces his first big test as speaker this week — trying to pass a debt ceiling bill through the House to push President Joe Biden to negotiate.

title: Hunter Biden's legal team wants investigation of an ex-Trump aide, congressional action against MTG
description: Hunter Biden’s legal team wants the Treasury Dept. to investigate an ex-Trump aide for circulating banking records linked to Biden and wants Congress to act against Marjorie Taylor Green for her statements.

title: Joe Biden set to tap Julie Chavez Rodriguez as his 2024 campaign manager
description: President Joe Biden plans to tap Julie Chavez Rodriguez as his 2024 campaign manager, two sources familiar with the decision confirmed to NBC News Sunday.
